title: go/parser placing comments in wrong place
body:
by **gjredelinghuys**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Compile and link the attached "bug.go"
2. Run bug.go
3. On screen will be displayed what is expected to appear in the
resultant hello.go file made by bug.go.
4. hello.go is uncompilable due to a comment having been placed
in the middle of a Printf call by either go's parser or printer library.

What is the expected output?
hello.go (that is produced by bug.go) should be nearly the same
as the screen output of bug.go. At the very least hello.go should
be compilable.

What do you see instead?
hello.go can not be compiled

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g version release.2011-02-01.1 7434

Which operating system are you using?
Ubuntu 10.10 64 bit (linux kernel: 2.6.35-25-generic)

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
08d3cede7e02

Please provide any additional information below.
bug.go is attached
Attachments: 1. bug.go (1283 bytes)
